text: ਤਿਲੰਗ ਬਾਣੀ ਭਗਤਾ ਕੀ ਕਬੀਰ ਜੀ
section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Tilang, The Word Of Devotee Kabeer Jee:

transliteration.text: tilang bānī bhagatā kī kabīr jī

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਬੇਦ ਕਤੇਬ ਇਫਤਰਾ ਭਾਈ ਦਿਲ ਕਾ ਫਿਕਰੁ ਨ ਜਾਇ ॥
section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Vedas and the Scriptures are only make-believe, O Siblings of Destiny; they do not relieve the anxiety of the heart.

transliteration.text: bēd katēb iphatarā bhāī dil kā phikar n jāi .

melody.description: Tilang is full of the feeling of having tried hard to impress, but the feeling that the effort made has not been appreciated. However, the atmosphere is not of anger or upset, but of brooding, as the person you are trying to impress is very dear to you.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਟੁਕੁ ਦਮੁ ਕਰਾਰੀ ਜਉ ਕਰਹੁ ਹਾਜਿਰ ਹਜੂਰਿ ਖੁਦਾਇ ॥੧॥
section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: If you will only center yourself on the Lord, even for just a breath, then you shall see the Lord face-to-face, present before you. ||1||

transliteration.text: tuk dam karārī jau karah hājir hajūr khudāi .1.

melody.description: Tilang is full of the feeling of having tried hard to impress, but the feeling that the effort made has not been appreciated. However, the atmosphere is not of anger or upset, but of brooding, as the person you are trying to impress is very dear to you.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. text: ਬੰਦੇ ਖੋਜੁ ਦਿਲ ਹਰ ਰੋਜ ਨਾ ਫਿਰੁ ਪਰੇਸਾਨੀ ਮਾਹਿ ॥
section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O human being, search your own heart every day, and do not wander around in confusion.

transliteration.text: bandē khōj dil har rōj nā phir parēsānī māh .

melody.description: Tilang is full of the feeling of having tried hard to impress, but the feeling that the effort made has not been appreciated. However, the atmosphere is not of anger or upset, but of brooding, as the person you are trying to impress is very dear to you.

author.author: Saint Kabir

text: ਇਹ ਜੁ ਦੁਨੀਆ ਸਿਹਰੁ ਮੇਲਾ ਦਸਤਗੀਰੀ ਨਾਹਿ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: This world is just a magic-show; no one will be holding your hand. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: ih j dunīā sihar mēlā dasatagīrī nāh .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Tilang is full of the feeling of having tried hard to impress, but the feeling that the effort made has not been appreciated. However, the atmosphere is not of anger or upset, but of brooding, as the person you are trying to impress is very dear to you.

text: ਦਰੋਗੁ ਪੜਿ ਪੜਿ ਖੁਸੀ ਹੋਇ ਬੇਖਬਰ ਬਾਦੁ ਬਕਾਹਿ ॥
section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Reading and studying falsehood, people are happy; in their ignorance, they speak nonsense.

transliteration.text: darōg par par khusī hōi bēkhabar bād bakāh .

melody.description: Tilang is full of the feeling of having tried hard to impress, but the feeling that the effort made has not been appreciated. However, the atmosphere is not of anger or upset, but of brooding, as the person you are trying to impress is very dear to you.

text: ਹਕੁ ਸਚੁ ਖਾਲਕੁ ਖਲਕ ਮਿਆਨੇ ਸਿਆਮ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਨਾਹਿ ॥੨॥
section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The True Creator Lord is diffused into His creation; He is not just the dark-skinned Krishna of legends. ||2||

transliteration.text: hak sach khālak khalak miānē siām mūrat nāh .2.

melody.description: Tilang is full of the feeling of having tried hard to impress, but the feeling that the effort made has not been appreciated. However, the atmosphere is not of anger or upset, but of brooding, as the person you are trying to impress is very dear to you.

text: ਅਸਮਾਨ ਮ੍ਯਿਨੇ ਲਹੰਗ ਦਰੀਆ ਗੁਸਲ ਕਰਦਨ ਬੂਦ ॥
section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Through the Tenth Gate, the stream of nectar flows; take your bath in this.

transliteration.text: asamān myinē lahang darīā gusal karadan būd .

melody.description: Tilang is full of the feeling of having tried hard to impress, but the feeling that the effort made has not been appreciated. However, the atmosphere is not of anger or upset, but of brooding, as the person you are trying to impress is very dear to you.

text: ਕਰਿ ਫਕਰੁ ਦਾਇਮ ਲਾਇ ਚਸਮੇ ਜਹ ਤਹਾ ਮਉਜੂਦੁ ॥੩॥
section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Serve the Lord forever; use your eyes, and see Him ever-present everywhere. ||3||

transliteration.text: kar phakar dāim lāi chasamē jah tahā maujūd .3.

melody.description: Tilang is full of the feeling of having tried hard to impress, but the feeling that the effort made has not been appreciated. However, the atmosphere is not of anger or upset, but of brooding, as the person you are trying to impress is very dear to you.

text: ਅਲਾਹ ਪਾਕੰ ਪਾਕ ਹੈ ਸਕ ਕਰਉ ਜੇ ਦੂਸਰ ਹੋਇ ॥
section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Lord is the purest of the pure; only through doubt could there be another.

transliteration.text: alāh pākan pāk hai sak karau jē dūsar hōi .

melody.description: Tilang is full of the feeling of having tried hard to impress, but the feeling that the effort made has not been appreciated. However, the atmosphere is not of anger or upset, but of brooding, as the person you are trying to impress is very dear to you.

text: ਕਬੀਰ ਕਰਮੁ ਕਰੀਮ ਕਾ ਉਹੁ ਕਰੈ ਜਾਨੈ ਸੋਇ ॥੪॥੧॥
section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O Kabeer, mercy flows from the Merciful Lord; He alone knows who acts. ||4||1||

transliteration.text: kabīr karam karīm kā uh karai jānai sōi .4.1.

melody.description: Tilang is full of the feeling of having tried hard to impress, but the feeling that the effort made has not been appreciated. However, the atmosphere is not of anger or upset, but of brooding, as the person you are trying to impress is very dear to you.
